repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Making a difference in an
            European Union member state

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on
            Bulgaria’s economy. Bulgaria has come a long way from its
            difficult early years of transition to a market economy.
            Country’s’ main challenges were to mitigate the negative
            impact of the global economic crisis, to enhance
            productivity, and to strengthen public institutions and
            governance to accelerate convergence of living standards to
            average European Union countries. The Revenue Administration
            and Reform Project supported the integration of tax and
            social contribution revenue collection, to improve the
            effectiveness and efficiency of the public revenue
            collection system in Bulgaria and facilitate private sector
            development. The Social Investment and Employment Promotion
            Project brought school improvements, energy efficiency,
            water supply and sewerage to small villages, and enabled
            rehabilitation of homes for the elderly and for children
            without parental care. The Registration and Cadastre Project
            contributed to a secure and efficient real estate market.
            Bulgaria continued to make great strides in improving
            financial management and channeling increased revenue to
            programs that were delivering improved water connections,
            better schools, and renovated homes for the elderly.

Nivel de vida mejora en Bulgaria por su
            ingreso a la Unión Europea

This Results Profile focuses on
            Bulgaria’s economy. Bulgaria has come a long way from its

            Country’s’ main challenges were to mitigate the negative
            impact of the global economic crisis, to enhance
            productivity, and to strengthen public institutions and
            governance to accelerate convergence of living standards to

            water supply and sewerage to small villages, and enabled
            rehabilitation of homes for the elderly and for children
            without parental care. The Registration and Cadastre Project
            contributed to a secure and efficient real estate market.
            Bulgaria continued to make great strides in improving
            financial management and channeling increased revenue to

            better schools, and renovated homes for the elderly.

            CADASTRE PROJECT,TF025137-PHRD-LAND RESTITUTION &
            REGISTRATION PROJECT,TF025498-PHRD-BASIC EDUCATION II PROJECT,TF036715-BULGARIA - CADASTRE-LAND REGISTRATION,TF029454-PHRD-KALIMANTAN INTEGRATED CONSERVATION,TFM50265-Registration and Cadastre
            Project in Republic of Bulgaria,TFS50265-BULGARIA REGISTRATION AND
            CADASTRE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Registration and
            Cadastre Project (RCP) for Bulgaria were as follows: outcome
            was satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate;
            Bank performance was satisfactory; and borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Lessons learned include: Government
            had passed a law establishing the legal basis for land
            administration more than a year before Board approval, and
            the Cadastre Agency (CA) was established six months before
            approval. But the registration coordination unit was not
            established until 16 months after Board approval.
            Registration activities only got going after the
            Registration Agency (RA) had been created. Having only a
            coordination unit within the Ministry of Justice to oversee
            land administration activities of the district judiciaries
            was inadequate. District judiciary staffs were not solely
            answerable to the coordination unit and had many other
            duties besides land administration. It was not until the RA
            was formed a specialized agency with trained, full-time
            staff and a clear command structure that land registration
            got off the ground. RA and CA already have combined inflows
            from fees that cover operating costs. However, the fees or a
            portion thereof need to be retained by the agencies, and
            cadastral activities may need cross-subsidization from the
            RA to the CA. The RA has now reduced the time taken for its
            part of the registration process to one day. However,
            another 6 to 13 days are required for other institutions
            (The Municipality, Tax Department, etc.) to do their work.
            The opportunities for future improvements in efficiency will
            come primarily from these institutions. The RCP, by making
            land administration processes more efficient, has played a
            significant facilitating role in liberalizing the land
            market. But in broader terms this is not the only important
            influence on the land market. For instance, getting a
            construction permit, a frequent sequitur when a business
            buys a property, takes about 140 days and involves 24 procedures.

repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria case : making a difference in an
            EU member state

abstracts.cdata!:
Bulgaria's efforts to transition to
            a market economy were rewarded by membership in the European
            Union (EU) in 2007 but the country still faced steep
            challenges to elevate the income of its more than seven
            million people to the average seen in the EU. Partnering
            with International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
            (IBRD), Bulgaria continues to make great strides in
            improving financial management, channeling increased revenue
            to programs that are delivering new or improved water
            connections, better schools, and renovated homes for the elderly.

docna.cdata!:
Bulgaria case : making a difference in an EU
            member state

display_title.display_title:
Bulgaria case : making a
            difference in an EU member state
